meanings.definition: A lotion or cream applied to the skin to protect against the sun's harmful rays.
meanings.sent1: I always wear sunblock at the beach to shield my skin from the sun.
meanings.sent2: Remember to reapply sunblock every two hours for maximum protection.
meanings.sent3: The sunblock and sunglasses were best friends, always ready for a sunny adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like sunblock, protecting me from life's harsh realities.
meanings.sent5: The smell of coconut in the sunblock took me back to carefree summer days.

meanings.definition: To apply sunblock before going outside to prevent sunburn.
meanings.sent1: I need to sunblock my skin before heading to the pool.
meanings.sent2: She always sunblocks her face before going for a run in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to sunblock itself with a pawful of dirt, thinking it was sunscreen.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a sunblock, shielding her from the hurtful comments.
meanings.sent5: Before the hike, make sure to sunblock your arms and legs to avoid sun damage.
